page.title: 01BEDSTONE BUCKTON AND COXALL
page.content: Part of a larger area of gently rolling mixed farmland in the junction at the glaciated Teme and Clun Valleys, the block is dominated by the afforested Coxall Knoll and the pasture and parkland slopes at Bedstone Hill which occupy its western quarter. Farming and forestry are the only economical land uses, with the exception of Bedstone College, a private school occupying a victorian mansion with its surrounding parkland. Lying between and served by larger villages, the block only contains three isolated hamlets. Public electricity and telephone services are available for all, but no gas and for most of the population no public water nor sewage disposal services. Most individual users afford the latter for themselves by way of bottled gas, wells and septic tank systems.
